Description: Ostracon, fragment of the rim-section of a buff-coloured pottery bowl with slightly flaring sides and everted ledge-rim, the fabric is partially light-brown in section, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip, three lines of Coptic text written in black ink survive on the interior and a further two lines on the exterior.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (244116) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/244116)
